required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Locally Advanced VULvar CArcinoma in a Neoadjuvant Setting With Carboplatin and Paclitaxel Chemotherapy (VULCANize)
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Locally Advanced VULvar CArcinoma in a Neoadjuvant Setting With Carboplatin and Paclitaxel Chemotherapy (VULCANize)

brief_summary.textblock: Vulvar cancer is a rare malignancy. Surgery is the treatment of choice, but frequently causes invalidating and chronic postoperative morbidity, especially in patients with high stage disease. Theoretically, downstaging with neoadjuvant chemotherapy could shrink the tumour, making surgical treatment less extensive thereby diminishing the chance for morbidity.

detailed_description.textblock: Vulvar cancer is a rare malignancy. Surgery is the treatment of choice, but frequently causes invalidating and chronic postoperative morbidity, especially in patients with high stage disease. Theoretically, downstaging with neoadjuvant chemotherapy could shrink the tumour, making surgical treatment less extensive, thereby diminishing the chance for morbidity.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: a prospective, phase ll trial to investigate the response rate of carboplatin and paclitaxel in patients with locally advanced vulvar carcinoma

primary_outcome.measure: tumour size change by neoadjuvant chemotherapy
primary_outcome.description: tumour size change by neoadjuvant chemotherapy measured by RECIST 1.1

secondary_outcome.measure: avoidance of exenterative or invalidating surgery
secondary_outcome.description: number of patients were surgery can be reduced after the neo-adjuvant chemotherapy
Chemotherapy related morbidity measured by reported adverse events

clinical_study.condition: Locally Advanced, Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Vulva

arm_group.description: Paclitaxel 175 mg/m2 and Carboplatin AUC 5 in a 3 weekly schedule

intervention.description: Paclitaxel 175 mg/m2 and Carboplatin AUC 5 in a 3 weekly schedule

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Woman k 18 years
- Signed and written informed consent.
- Histologically confirmed squamous cell vulvar carcinoma
- World Health Organization performance status of 0-2
- Adequate hematological function
- Adequate hepatic function
- Adequate renal function
- Negative pregnancy test for woman of childbearing potential
- measurable disease by physical examination
- TNM stage T2, any N, MO
Exclusion Criteria:
- Vulvar cancer other than squamous cell carcinoma at biopsy
- Previous radiotherapy of the vulva, groins or pelvis
- Patients with metastasis limited to the pelvic lymph nodes, who can be primarily operated with curative intent
- Other diagnosis of malignancy or evidence of other malignancy for 5 years before screening for this study
